channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: WeWork Is Going Public Via SPAC
item.description: Now, WeWork is back up to a respectable $9 billion valuation. , to make its debut in the public markets, which have been waiting for WeWork like a prom date at the bottom of the stairs since 2019.  CEO Sandeep Mathrani expects WeWork to turn a profit by the end of this year, following some belt-tightening measures he made last summer. Now, flexible office space is back in demand, and WeWork 2.0 provides just that. WeWork is going public.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Germany Avoids “Baby Bust” With Rising Birth Rates
item.description: This jump in births runs counter to the current and even pre-pandemic fertility rates in the rest of Europe, the US, and other wealthy nations: There will be 300,000 fewer births this year in the US, according to estimates. No one’s totally sure, but some economists are pointing to Kurzarbeit, Germany’s state-funded safety net.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Dominion Voting Systems Files $1.6 Billion Lawsuit Against Fox News
item.description: And yesterday, lawyers for Dominion left the door open for going after individual Fox News broadcasters as well.  The lawsuit argues that Fox News leveraged its platform to defame Dominion, severely damaging its business in the process.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Vaccine Tracker: March 27
item.description: At the current rate, the US would hit President Biden’s new goal of 200 million shots administered in his first 100 days. Moderna said earlier this month it had started testing its vaccine on kids.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 27
item.description: (Guernica)  Read: Your Saturday deep dive into the underworld of finch smuggling. The ship will probably remain stuck in the canal, blocking all traffic, until at least next week.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Bank of England Reveals New £50 Banknote Honoring Alan Turing
item.description: The banknote includes an image of Turing, one of his quotes, and lots of nerdy Easter eggs such as a string of ticker tape displaying Turing's birthday in binary code.   In his work solving Enigma, he came up with the "Turing bombe," a precursor to the modern computer.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Darden Restaurants is Raising Wages as a Sign of Sales
item.description: At one point during the pandemic, same-store sales at Darden restaurants dropped 75%. Darden Restaurants, the parent company of Olive Garden, said hourly workers will make at least $10/hour in wages + tips combined starting Monday. now. Then vs.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Massive Container Ship Ever Given Still Stuck in the Suez Canal
item.description: But that's like driving from New York to Philadelphia via Calgary: It adds 6,000 miles and $300,000 in fuel costs to the journey.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: H&M, Nike Face Backlash in China
item.description: Ex.: Last September, H&M released a statement saying it was concerned about allegations of forced labor in Xinjiang, a Chinese territory that produces an estimated 20% of the world’s cotton. State media outlets called out other apparel brands, including Nike and Adidas, that've made statements about boycotting Xinjiang cotton. And celebrities including Wang Yibo and Victoria Song are dropping H&M and/or Nike endorsements.   On Tuesday, a human rights group coalition sent a letter to Airbnb asking it to pull out, questioning the company's commitment to "social responsibility."
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The Brew’s Weekly News Quiz: March 26
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Business Acronyms You Should Know: The Master Guide
item.description: DOJ: The Department of Justice enforces US laws and handles federal civil and criminal cases. In business-to-business (B2B), the product is for a corporate customer.  SEC: The Securities and Exchange Commission is a federal agency that regulates securities markets (securities = financial instruments like stocks and bonds) to protect investors. US agencies and regulators  CDC: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention; if you don't know this after a year of Covid…it is responsible for promoting public health at home and abroad, responding to infectious diseases, and researching threats to human health.   FTC: The Federal Trade Commission is responsible for enforcing consumer protection laws and civil antitrust law. ) The finance-y stuffIPO: An initial public offering is a way for companies to go from private → public and raise capital by selling shares to public investors on a stock exchange.  WHO: The World Health Organization is a UN agency focused on public health—monitoring risks, responding to emergencies, promoting universal healthcare, and setting international standards.  OECD: The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development is an economic organization of 37 so-called "developed" nations. 19 members are part of the common currency "eurozone,." S&P: Standard & Poor's (now known as S&P Global) is an analytics and financial data corporation. In direct-to-consumer, companies like Warby Parker send their product straight to you. But, often, the business world can feel like a jumble of insider language and acronyms. ESG: Environmental, social, and governance is a framework that measures corporations' positions on issues like human rights, diversity, employee welfare, and climate impacts. It's one of the most widely used indicators of economic health. It's goal is to coordinate prices and keep oil markets stable. UI: User experience vs. It's goal is to promote economic development and global trade. CSR: Corporate social responsibility offers a model for businesses to have a positive impact on society and remain accountable not only to shareholders, but also to the public.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Bank of England Reveals New £50 Banknote Honoring Alan Turing
item.description: The banknote includes an image of Turing, one of his quotes, and lots of nerdy Easter eggs such as a string of ticker tape displaying Turing's birthday expressed in binary.   In his work solving Enigma, he came up with the "Turing bombe," a precursor to the modern computer.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: H&M, Nike Face Backlash in China After Calling Out Xinjiang Labor Concerns
item.description: State media outlets called out other apparel brands, including Nike and Adidas, that've made statements about boycotting Xinjiang cotton. And celebrities including Wang Yibo and Victoria Song are dropping H&M and/or Nike endorsements.  Ex.: Last September, H&M released a statement saying it was concerned about allegations of forced labor in Xinjiang, a territory that produces an estimated 20% of the world’s cotton. This week, that statement got attention from internet users in China, who joined state officials and businesses there in making this a week for hell for H&M.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Slack Debuts, then Immediately Retracts, Cross-Organizational Messaging Feature
item.description: The backstory: In the version that debuted yesterday morning, any paid Slack user could DM any other Slack user if they had their email address. Yesterday, Slack rolled out a feature called Slack Connect that allows users to direct message people at other organizations...
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 25
item.description: (TJCX)  Read: How the New York Times A/B tests their headlines. Warren was wondering why the Biden administration hasn't put more scrutiny on BlackRock, which manages 180x more assets than banks deemed "too big to fail" post-financial crisis.

item.title: Sponsors, Investors Distance Themselves from David Dobrik
item.description: On Sunday, Dobrik said he would leave Dispo and step down from the board.  Seven Seven Six, another investor, said it would donate any profits made from Dispo to organizations supporting survivors of sexual assault.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Gas Prices Could Pass $3 Per Gallon
item.description: Gas prices always tend to rise leading up to the summer, but the 2021 jump can be attributed to two biggies: 1) large, pent-up demand to drive through the mountains listening to Lana's new album and 2) oil refiners not yet refining at full speed.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Suez Canal Blocked by Giant Container Ship Causes a Global Shipping Backup
item.description: On Tuesday, a gargantuan cargo ship named the Ever Given ran aground in the busy Suez Canal, blocking maritime traffic from entering or exiting the crucial shipping highway. If you're wondering how a ship that weighs 220,000 tons and is the size of the Empire State Building ended up sideways, canal officials say high winds from a sandstorm restricted visibility around the time the ship got stuck.  As of last night, over 100 ships were stuck at each end of the 120-mile canal, putting even more pressure on the global shipping industry that was already out of whack from the pandemic.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: How the CEO of Swivel Beauty Does Her Taxes
item.description: It’s also important that they understand how you like to see the numbers. I’d never started a business before, so I was Googling everything from, “How do you incorporate your business?”  JT: You certainly don’t have to be one as a startup—plenty of businesses start out as LLCs or general C-corps—but a lot of the literature, at least that we read at the time, recommended this.    MB: How did you go about incorporating the business? New York City also had a grant program to help small business owners retain employees, especially when businesses were closed. One fun one was we were a recipient for a grant Beyoncé had with the NAACP.  JT: We started with a lawyer and ended up incorporating our business as a Delaware C-corp, which a lot of startups do. MB: Did Covid-19 affect anything about the way you’ll do your taxes this year? Make sure that you like who you’re working with because this is the important stuff. If you structure everything correctly from the beginning, when the money does start rolling in, you’re going to be really happy that you did.  JT: We did a lot of research online, like with anything. Having an accountant who really understood that and understood how money flowed through our business was incredibly important. Swivel was born out of wanting to solve a problem I had, but also because I knew a lot of other women who were struggling with this as well.  JT: I would say even if you’re not making a ton of money in the beginning, still set up the right processes when it comes to your business. Set up a separate business account. Again, because we’re a marketplace, we like to see how much money is flowing to each of the vendors on our platform.  Morning Brew: For those who don’t know, what is Swivel Beauty and how’d you come up with the business idea?
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: Suez Canal Blocked by Giant Container Ship Causes a Global Shipping Backup

If you're wondering how a ship that weighs 220,000 tons and is the size of the Empire State Building ended up sideways, canal officials say there were high winds from a sandstorm restricting visibility around the time the ship got stuck.  As of last night, over 100 ships are stuck at each end of the 120-mile canal, putting even more pressure on the global shipping industry that was already out of whack from the pandemic.

item.title: Sponsors, Investors Distance Themselves from David Dobrik
item.description: On Sunday, Dobrik said he would leave Dispo and step down from the board. YouTube star and cofounder of photo sharing app Dispo David Dobrik is getting dropped by sponsors and investors over accusations of sexual harassment and assault directed at his "Vlog Squad."

item.title: Q&A: Is Bitcoin a Store of Value?
item.description: Bitcoin has been compared to gold, which is known as the ultimate example of a store of value because it's scarce and doesn't break down over time. Have another question about business and the economy?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: Quote: "Stock markets in general and our stock price in particular have recently experienced extreme price and volume fluctuations that have often been unrelated or disproportionate to the operating performance of those companies and our company."

item.title: GoPuff's Value Jumps Thanks to Munchies and Lockdown
item.description: Zoom out: Food and grocery delivery seemed to explode during the pandemic, and goPuff reported that its order volume increased 400% in the first half of 2020.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Citigroup Embraces Flexibility to Curb Pandemic Fatigue
item.description: May 28 (the Friday before Memorial Day) will be a company-wide holiday called "Citi Reset Day." Fraser also sketched out a more flexible approach to work after the pandemic recedes.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: US Regulatory Panel Questions AstraZeneca Vaccine Results
item.description: In the wee hours of Tuesday morning, when nothing good ever happens, a panel that oversees US clinical trial safety said AstraZeneca's vaccine results may include "outdated and potentially misleading" data. Big picture: Vaccine hesitancy, in the US and abroad, started out higher than public health officials wanted. Add this to the growing listWhile AstraZeneca's vaccine has been authorized in 70+ countries, the rollout has faced Galaxy Note 7-level challenges. AstraZeneca's vaccine is less effective than Pfizer's and Moderna's vaccines and (pending further data) potentially also Johnson & Johnson's one-shot option.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: GoPuff's Value Jumps Thanks to Munchies and Lockdown
item.description: But if goPuff is the Kirsten Dunst of the snack- and household item delivery world, cue the Clovers ready to Bring It On:Amazon's 2-hour Fresh service, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Postmates, and Instacart have all expanded categories that try to grab some of that goPuff market.
item.author: Matty Merritt
